titlestmt.titleproper: YWCA of the U.S.A. Records. Oversized Materials.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Maida Goodwin, Amy Hague, Kara McClurken, Amanda Izzo.
titlestmt.sponsor: Processing of the YWCA Records was made possible by the generous support of the National Historical Records and Publications Commission and the estate of Elizabeth Norris.

publicationstmt.p: Sophia Smith Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Carrie Baldwin. July 11, 2008

did.head: Record Group Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Young Women's Christian Association of the U.S.A.

did.unittitle: YWCA of the U.S.A. Records. Oversized Materials
did.abstract: This record group includes oversized materials documeting the work of the YWCA from the 1890s to the present. Forms part of the YWCA of the U.S.A. Records.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection without any additional restrictions.
Access to audiovisual materials may first require production of research copies.

userestrict.p: The YWCA of the USA retains copyright ownership of the records, but has authorized the Sophia Smith Collection to grant permission to publish reproductions or quotations from the records on its behalf.

Copyright to materials authored by persons other than YWCA staff may be owned by those individuals or their heirs or assigns. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights for permission to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
YWCA of the U.S.A. Records, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

altformavail.head: Additional Formats
altformavail.p: A copy of the microfilmed records of the YWCA of the U.S.A. Records is available to borrow from the William Allan Neilson Library at Smith College via Interlibrary Loan.

p.title: To request the microfilm from our library you will need to submit the following information to your library's Interlibrary Loan department:

list.item: Author: Young Women's Christian Association of the U.S.A. National Board
Notes: "Call # 689" and reel number(s) you want to borrow

altformavail.p: Full descriptions and reel lists of the microfilm are available online.

acqinfo.p: The YWCA of the U.S.A. donated a portion of its records to the Sophia Smith Collection in 1964 and the remainder in 2002 and 2003.

processinfo.p: Processed by Maida Goodwin, Amy Hague, Kara McClurken, Amanda Izzo, 2008 FY 07-08

odd.head: Record Groups
odd.p: The YWCA of the USA Records are arranged as follows:

list.item: YWCA of the U.S.A. Records (main record)

item.extref: RECORD GROUP 2. PREDECESSOR ORGANIZATIONS AND NATIONAL BOARD
RECORD GROUP 4. NATIONAL CONVENTIONS AND CONFERENCES

relatedmaterial.p: This Record group forms part of the YWCA of the U.S.A. Records.

did.unittitle: BOXED ITEMS
Mounted posters 135th Anniversary, 1993-94

note.p: [see also unmounted posters in flat file]

did.unittitle: "Women First for 135 Years" art and design by Saul Bass
Reproduction Poster Series I
Health and Fitness-Mother & Child ("Building for Health" by Marie Page)
Health and Fitness-Swim ("Swim!" by Anita Parkhurst)
Health and Fitness-The Gym ("Join the Gym," artist unknown)
Reproduction Poster Series II
WWI Service-Marching Women Workers ("For Every Fighter a Woman Worker, Back Our Second Line of Defense" by Ernest Hamlin Baker)
WWI Service-Care for Her ("For Every Fighter a Woman Worker, Care for Her Through the YWCA" by Adolph Treidler)
YWCA Program-Foreign Born ("For United America, Division for Foreign Born" by C. Howard Walker)
Reproduction Poster Series III
YWCA Program-Students of the World ("World Fellowship, the Students of the United States for the Students of the World" by Adolph Treidler)
YWCA Program-Room Registry ("Call on Us if You Want Comfortable Accommodations," artist unknown)
MOUNTED POSTERS, GENERAL
"Forever Young and Brave," World Centennial, 1955
"They go to church, they go to school, they go to work, they go to the YWCA. Keep them going," 1950s
"See the World in a New Light Through the YWCA" art by Fanuele, early 1960s and "Where You Can Belong," circa 1962
"The YWCA Belongs to You" [Asian woman, white woman], circa 1964
National YWCA Week designs, 1960s-early 1970s
"Building a Better Community, Give to the World Through the YWCA" and "Say 'Yes' Give to the World Through the YWCA," undated
"China develops her Co-operative Industries to aid her 60,000,000 Refugees"
NAACP map "3436 Blots of Same on the U.S. 1889-1922" from Outline for a Discussion Course on Race Relations in the U.S. in box 538 folder 16
Photograph album, 600 Lexington Ave under construction and newly complete, exteriors and interiors, circa 1912-13
Looseleaf binder for YWCA Program Resources Organizers' Kits, 1990s
Asilomar Inventory, 1942
National YWCA Staff Design (proposed), 1971-72
The Augusta Courier, 12 Dec 1955
Interregional News Bulletin, spring 1956
Commemorative collection from dedication of Peace Site at the Leadership Development Center, 25 Aug 1987
FLAT FILES
RECORD GROUP 1. GENERAL AND HISTORY
Poster with revised Purpose statement, circa 1990
"Picture What Women Do" calendar 1995, published by Lifetime [YWCA featured in month of Mar]
Posters with text of the YWCA Purpose, circa 1970s-90s

Anniversaries: World YWCA Centennial, 1955: posters, printed material; Resolutions from various states and cities, 1983, 1993; 135th Anniversary exhibit, information and layout; posters, 125th (1983) and 135th (1993)
Annual Reports: 1979-80, 1980-81
Awards: certificates from various organizations, 1951-93
Organization and committee structure charts, 1940-72
Membership certificates, 1906, n.d.
'Foreign' YWCAs

YWCA of China: Illustrations for Better Homes Campaign, Shanghai, 1921; "Itinerant Industries of China" from North-China Daily News Christmas Supplement [date in Chinese characters]; "Pictures of the City Centers" fold-out from Green Year Supplement, Jul 1930; The China Press Sunday Pictorial Section, 24 Oct 1926; pictorial charts re women and work in Shanghai [date in Chinese]; miscellaneous unidentified items

YWCA of Egypt: souvenir "with our deep appreciation for your hospitality," n.d. Papyrus (?) with images of Goddess Isis leading queen Nefertiti into eternity and King Rameses II on his chariot of war, XIX dynasty
YWCA of Korea: map showing location of YWCAs; unidentified illustration
YWCA of Manila: certificate of recognition and appreciation to the YWCA of the USA, Oct 1951
World YWCA posters, 1957, 1960, 1987, 1990, n.d.
RECORD GROUP 2. PREDECESSOR ORGANIZATIONS AND NATIONAL BOARD
American Committee listing of YWCAs (from 1887 Annual Report)
National Board meeting minutes oversize attachments, 1927-42
Board of Trustees meeting minutes oversize attachments, 1922-25
RECORD GROUP 3. NATIONAL ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE
SERIES I. GENERAL ADMINISTRATION
Controversy: press compilations related to "Behind the Lace Curtains," 1948
Legal: proofs for Y-Teen patterns, 1959
SERIES II. BUILDINGS AND PROPERTIES
Asilomar Conference Grounds
Map of 50 acre grounds, n.d.
Plan of Asilomar properties, 1917

National Headquarters, 600 Lexington Ave., New York City: scale detail,counters in reception corridor and exhibition hall, 1913; Mail chute details, 1912; floorplans for National Board library renovation, 1959

Leadership Development Center, Phoenix, Arizona: site plan, Clark/Van Voorhis Architects, 3 Jul 1981; partial floor plan, 1981; artwork for LDC information packets, n.d.; first anniversary poster, 1984
SERIES III. FINANCE AND DEVELOPMENT
Comptroller's Office: documents re China property, 1919, n.d.; Grace Dodge Hotel registration chart, 1922
Publications: flyers, charts, press spread, paid advertisement, 1940s-50s, 1985
SERIES VI. PUBLICITY

Press clipping compilation "YWCA Speaks for White Collar Workers," 1942; National YWCA Week: 1946-47 press clipping compilations; JobCorps-YWCA spread in The Corpsman, 15 May 1970; YWCA Year at a Glance calendars, 1999-2000; "Stretch Out at the YWCA" newspaper guidelines, circa 1990s
SERIES VI. PUBLICITY (cont'd)
Posters

Photograph of 1952 National YWCA Week poster "On Our Own But Not Alone"; "Here's Your Cue to a Happier You" membership recruitment poster, 1950s?; "Come and Join!" membership recruitment poster, 1950s?; "Join and Look Ahead with the YWCA" public service poster distributed by Campbell Soup Co., featuring Donna Reed, circa 1960s; "There is no such thing as seeking God for there is nothing in which he could not be found, YWCA" green and white, circa 1970s; "Publicity Gives You Extra Program Push," 1978; "Celebrate a New Beginning" designed by Bass Yager Associations, 1980s
General publicity and membership recruitment, 1950s-early 1970s
RECORD GROUP 4. CONVENTION
Posters, ballots, credentials application blanks, flow charts of Convention process, exhibition hall layouts, 1910s-90s
Poster for 1926 Convention
RECORD GROUP 5. INTERNATIONAL WORK
Cartoon "World Fellowship Ahoy! The International Cruise of the Trusty Tub 'Goodwill' of the Salvation Navy" by Barbara Abel and Florence Nichols, published in the Womans Press, Sep 1927
Photo spreads of American staff abroad printed in Association Monthly and Woman's Press, 1917 and 1949
Awards certificates, 1971, n.d.
Publicity flyers, 1956, 1959
Posters

"Building a Better Community. Give to the World Through the YWCA," 1959; "The YWCA at Work in the World," 2 different versions, n.d.; "Our Share in the World (World Fellowship Giving)," n.d.; "Come Celebrate World Mutual Service Week," 1974
"Behind the news are PEOPLE and those who try to help. YWCA Refugee Services," 1960s
RECORD GROUP 6. PROGRAM
SERIES I. DEPARTMENT, STAFF, AND COMMITTEES
Chart "Program in the YWCA" prepared by Bureau of Research and Program Resources, Apr 1963; Resource Center on Women prospectus and funding proposal, 1970
SERIES II. PERSONNEL AND TRAINING

National Training School certificates, 1910-11 (Crissey McLemore), 1925 (Mildred Owen); Poster "Explore Career Opportunities in YWCAs Throughout the USA," n.d.; Financial reports for Career Volunteer Development Project, 1983
SERIES III. PUBLIC ADVOCACY
Posters

"Conquer Fear of Insecurity and War by World Economic Co-Operation," and "Do You Remember Novemeber 11th? Permanent World Peace can be maintained by World Economic Co-operation," Campaign for World Economic Co-Operation, 1938 [distributed by YWCA]; "How the I.L.O. Works," International Labor Organization, 1939? [distributed by YWCA]; "Four Freedoms" series, 1944 [distributed by YWCA];
"Now is the Time" series, 1944; "Women's No. 1 War Duty," 1943-44

"It's All the Same to Him," 1945 [blood plasma, distributed by YWCA]; Citizens Food Committee poster re conserving wheat and meat, 1947 [distributed by YWCA]; "Misinformation Vintage '49" [distributed by YWCA]; "Support the National Health Insurance Bill," circa 1950 [distributed by YWCA]; American Emergency Food Committee clippings collage poster, 1950-51 [distributed by YWCA]; "Your Vote is Your Voice," AFSCME, circa 1996 [distributed by YWCA]; 2 posters for United Nations Day, October 24, n.d. [distributed by YWCA]
Miscellaneous

U.S. Government Clip Sheet , George Washington Bicentennial Commission, 1932; Digest of official letters and communications regarding the Public Affairs Program, July 1945-1946; Articles: "Coast Japs are Interned in Mountain Camp," Life, 6 Apr 1942 and "The People Nobody Wants," n.d.; Reprint from Seventeen re Bretton Woods plan for cooperation in International Finance, 1945; Flyer: "The Colored Electorate Expects FEPC in '48"; Text of declaration of human rights, reprinted from Chicago Sun-Times, 11 Dec 1948; Statement by United States National Women's Organizations, 23 Jun 1952 [re United Nations Disarmament Commission]; News clippings collage, Status of Women, 1963; Press statement "A Call to Women Who Care," 1966; Chart: "Civil Rights and Land Development, background on housing for Negroes in Cleveland, Ohio," 1966
Programs and Projects
Week Without Violence: posters, enlarged clippings, flyer layout, proclamation, 1996
Women's Political Empowerment: poster series: "Most Politicians Still think women should be seen and not heard. In the last election 54 million women agreed," The Deciding Vote, Women's Vote [19]'96
SERIES IV. CONSTITUENT GROUPS
Subseries B. Immigration and Foreign Communities

Chart showing "the constituents of the population in cities of more than 100,000 inhabitants, 1920"; Flyer "America's Future Immigration Problem" published by the National Committee for Constructive Immigration Legislation, 1920; Diploma for Polish Gray Samaritan Training School, n.d.
Subseries C. Interracial/Racial Justice

Awards and proclamations: certificate of Merit, U.S. Public Health Service, 1949; National Conference of Christians and Jews, 1974; Office of the Mayor, City of Phoenix, 1990; Office of the Mayor, Washington, DC, 1993
3 press statements, Oct-Nov 1966: "A Call to Women Who Care";"Black Power" Statement by National Committee of Negro Churchmen; "Crisis and Commitment"

Poster/flyers for Institutes on the Web of Racism, 1970-72; "Elimination of Racism," One Imperative posters, circa 1971; Flyer "Some Highlights of Steps Along the Way to the One Imperative," 1979 and 1985; poster: "Simple Ways to End Racism," 1994; Reference materials Black Chronicle, circa 1970s
Poster "The YWCA Audits its Community to Break the Web of Racism," Center for Racial Justice, 1973
Subseries D. Teen Age and Younger Girls

Posters: "The Girl Reserves of the YWCA. Help us put the Blue Triangle over the top!" Poucher, n.d. [mounted, torn]; "Girl Reserves, Ever Loyal, Ever Ready, Everywhere," Anita Parkhurst, n.d. [mounted, torn, many pin holes]; "In Service for the Girls of the World," Neysa McMein, 1919 (3)

Chart "Activities for the Girl Citizen,"1920s?; 3 Sample issues of The Girl Reserve Bookshelf to demonstrate the original format [photocopies filed in box 570], 1923-25; Girl Reserve Jubilee greetings from Estonia Girl Reserves, 1931; Collage of Girl Reserve Jubilee greetings from around the world, 1931; chart/poster, '"Teen-Agers" Keep Fit and Have Fun,' illustrations by Henrietta Wireman, USO Division

Posters: "Y-Teen Week, Teens for Peace, Teens for Justice, Teens for Freedom, Teens for Dignityâ€¦for all people. The YWCA is for Teens!" 1974(2); "Fuel YWCA Programs with Teen Energy, Join Y-Teens," n.d. (2); "Teen Women the Force is With You at the YWCA," n.d. (2)
SERIES V. PROGRAM SUBJECTS
Subseries A. Camping and Outdoor Recreation: flyer re Second National YWCA Conference on Outdoor Recreation and Conservation, Jul 1966

Subseries B. Health and Recreation: Suggested "Skeleton" or "Back-Bone" Program for Constructive Health Programs through Standardized Clubs, Bureau of Social Education, 1920; Original artwork for ENCOREplus publications by Janet Hamlin, 1990s; "Get into the Game!" National Girls and Women in Sports Day poster, 1990s
Subseries C. Music Descant for "Goodnight, Beloved" by Lucy Schulte
Subseries E. Religion: chart "The Evolution of a Social Gospel," circa1951
SERIES VI. PUBLICATIONS
Woman's Press advertising stickers, n.d.
SERIES VII. WAR WORK AND DEFENSE SERVICES
World War I

Special Peace Talk Newspaper Advertisements for the United War Work Campaign, 11-18 Nov 1918 (4); Reprint of New York Times cartoon "Ain't it a Grand and Glorious Feelin'?" by Briggs with text "The Men Know, Home Folks Know, YWCA Hostess Houses in Seventy Camps"; "A Miss Sehon, a l'occasion de son departtribute to Clarrette Sehon from "Les jeunes filles du Foyer," Bourges, 28 May 1920; "Card of Recognition" from Poland with thanks for food assistance to Polish children after World War I;Sheet music for "Get Behind the Girls Behind the Boys" music by Nat Goldstein, lyrics by Anita Day Downing. Official song of the YWCA Western Department, n.d.
Posters

"Back Our Girls Over There, United War Work Campaign YWCA," Clarence Underwood [operator, 1 copy unmounted, 1 copy mounted with glue spots]; "YMCA, Lend Your Strength to the Red Triangle. Help the Y Help the Fighters Fight," Gil Spear; "Joan of Arc Saved France. Women of America Save Your Country, Buy War Savings Stamps," Haskell Coffin, U.S. Treasury Department poster

"United We Serve," United War Work Campaign [no art] (2); fragments of a Neysa McMein United War Work Campaign poster; "How the Blue Triangle Helps in France" [small, bullet points, no art]; "Remember the Girl Behind the Man Behind the Gun, YWCA, War Work Council," M.B. [nurse bursting through blue triangle]
"The Girl on the Land Serves the Nation's Need," Edward Penfield
"For Every Fighter a Woman Worker," Adolph Treidler (3 copies); United War Work Campaign "United We Serve"
"For Every Fighter a Woman Worker," Ernest Hamlin Baker; "His Home Over There," Albert Herter [YM/YW]

World War II and Defense Services: Awards and certificates,1946-68; Press clipping compilations, 1941-42; War Community Services map, 1945; Bridgeport, Connecticut, Herald page re opening of USO building, 1942
RECORD GROUP 7. STUDENT WORK
75th Anniversary spread in Woman's Press,1948; Membership certificates: Oberlin College YWCA, 1989, and Boise State University YWCA, 1991; Flyer re National Student YWCA, circa 1970s
RECORD GROUP 8. COMMUNITY ASSOCIATIONS
Department/Division: Community Division poster "Why Support Your National Organization?" 1969
Community Associations files
Alabama: "Quiet Revolutionairies: The YWCA of Mobile" poster, 1989
California
Hollywood Studio Club oversize clippings, 1950s; California Monthly cover story "Y's women," Feb 1989; "Legacy of Courage-YWCA Celebrates women in Orange County History," poster, n.d.
Survey of a portion of Block 11 Colegrove MR 53-10 at NW Corner of Lexington Ave & Lodi Place for Hollywood Studio Club, Julia Morgan, Architect [page from specifications in box 857. folder 6], 1925
Oakland: plan for proposed remodeling, Warneke and Warneke, Architects, 1954
Illinois: YWCA of Chicago(?) "Regulations of the Boarding House," n.d. [printed by Knight, Leonard & Co., Chicago]
Iowa: Des Moines Sunday Register cover story re new YWCA building, 1971
Louisiana: Shreveport YWCA poster by Gary Cascio, n.d.
New York: YWCA of the City of New York flow chart showing relationships local to national to World YWCA, 1932
New Jersey, Summit: Plot plan for proposed new addition, Ludlow and Jefferson, Architects, 1966
Ohio: Cleveland YWCA Annual Report (poster format), 1981
Pennsylvania: reproduction of a mural-like pencil drawing with YWCA theme by Nick T. Ruggieri, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania YWCA, 1960s?
Unidentified: "Where You Can Belong" series (YWCA, 5th and Seneca), n.d.
RECORD GROUP 9. PHOTOGRAPHS

Saturday Evening Post cover, 25 Mar 1944, "Gramercy Park" by John Falter showing #3, the first home of the YWCA National Training School (1908-summer 1913); Reception, National Association YWCA, Panama Pacific International Exposition, San Francisco, California, 18 May 1915; Group photo, International Institutes Conference, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, 1926; Group photo, World's YWCA Council Meeting, Elgin House, Muskoka, Canada, Sep 1938; 3 enlargements of exhibition photographs: Y-Teens, National Industrial Progress Week, and World Fellowship ("The World We Build Rests on the Character We Build")

Unidentified conference, Midwest, n.d.; Western City Conference, Hollister, MO, 1918; Southeast Regional Conference, Blue Ridge, NC, 1954; National Industrial Conference, silver Spring, MD, 1919 [2 different photos, 1 of them in pieces]; National Industrial Council, 1926; Blue Ridge Student Conference, 1912; Southeast Student YM and YW Conference, Hollister, MO, 1927, 1928, 1929; Foreign Division of YWCA of the U.S.A. and YWCA of Canada, 1929; World Council, 1938, 1955, 1967
"O'Goshen" Girls Camp, Louisville, KY, YWCA, 1919
YWCA Conference, Kenilworth Inn, Asheville, NC, 1908
5th National Convention, Los Angeles, CA, 1915
29th National Convention, Washington, DC, 1982
